website_summaries.verdict: Quality cable management with a modern design at desirable price point.
pros: The E-Box is constructed with sturdy, reliable materials
Sufficient ventilation located at the bottom of the box, so it's hidden from the eye
The legs keep this box slightly elevated from the ground
The white and grey design gives a sleek, modern look
20 hook-and-loop ties are included for interior box organization
cons: The lid is almost too secure, takes some strength to pop it open

website_summaries.verdict: A thoughtfully-designed box that wrangles cords in a sleek, minimalist manner. Some users debate whether or not it's childproof.
pros: Raised inner plate keeps wires out of liquid in case of accidental spills
Raised lip keeps devices from slipping off the top when charging
Grid design and vented bottom helps to keep prevent overheating
Includes hook-and-loop ties to keep cords from tangling inside box
cons: Some say the lid is not particularly child-proof

customer_reviews.title: Stylish design touches the thankless world of cable management.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely style for a 'contemporary' installation look. My two cons are: The gaps one lower left and right side to pass the cables through are narrower than expected, requiring me to force certain cables through them. The lid never quite feels firmly seated. If you need to accommodate a lot of thick cabling, there is a chance it will flex above the lid line, and the lid does not 'click' into place to hold it down inside the box. You need to arrange the cables so none of them are pressing against the lid. Pro: The box is big enough to hold six connections (in my case) including two that have beefy converters.
customer_reviews.author: Beemer903

customer_reviews.title: Fit my surge protector & offered ventilation = won me over
customer_reviews.text: Was in dire need of one of these. Choose this one for two reasons, it fit my surge protector, and it was ventilated. Ventilation is very key if you are going to be plugging a lot of things into the box. Other reviews noted having difficulty getting it off, I did not have any trouble but others did. Wish it came in other colors, other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Parris

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a cord chewer so I have a hard time doing things like charging my cell phone, etc. when the cord is visible. He even seemed to find them when I "hid" them from him. I bought a couple of these cable boxes. I use one by my bed on the night stand and one in the living room for when company comes. I put power strips in them and am able to put my phone - cord and all - as well as other things like my Kindle inside the box to charge and don't have to worry about the cords being chewed in half or my cat electrocuting himself! Added bonus - they look nice!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: This is bigger than what I expected, harder to use than what I expected, nice looking.
customer_reviews.text: This is bigger than what I expected, harder to use than what I expected, nice looking. I tried so hard to put this together with my cords. I put my power strip inside and tried to thread the cords through the small openings. This looks more like a shoebox on the floor. Needs better design. Check on the size before purchasing in my opinion. Good idea just not good for me.
customer_reviews.author: kstars

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetic Functionality
customer_reviews.text: This cable box really works well for the purpose (controlling cable clutter under a desk. It's really easy to use. The flat top means you can place something on it as well, which is handy. I wasn't sure this was going to be a really useful item - but after several months, it really is.
customer_reviews.author: TMTime

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I own a couple other cable boxes and their designs are different because the just have cut outs on the sides to allow cords to come out. This one is unique because while there are two slots on the top where cords can come out of, you have the option to to feed cords underneath and the weight of the box and other cords hold it in place. This makes it a very clean look and tidier than other boxes. I like it a lot, but it is small/narrow so if your plugs jut out in weird directions, it may not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fan

customer_reviews.title: cheap yet expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different cable management boxes and of the two this was by far the lesser in terms of appearance and quality. It was packaged stylishly but that's about all it had going for it. The plastic is soft and cheap. If it's on the floor where a chair might get pushed in it or someone accidentally kicks it: it's going to get trashed. Ugly shiny cheap plastic. How cheap? You know those cheap plastic storage bins you can get to hold pencils? Softer and cheaper than that. There are lots of other choices for a product like this. Chose something else.
customer_reviews.author: McJeeee

customer_reviews.title: Pricy But Perfectly Functional
customer_reviews.text: Even though the dimensions are clearly stated, it was still bigger than I expected. Turns out that extra space is needed though. This came with a bunch of velcro "cord wranglers" so I could bunch up all of the excess safely inside with plenty of breathing room. My 8-month-old has happened upon this a couple of times and it kept her out! Looks clean and nice -- I've even had friends comment on it and they were surprised and then excited at what it is. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Anti-Clutter Freaks (like me) Will Like This A lot!
customer_reviews.text: I use my breakfast bar as a work station. The tangle of wires: laptop, speakers, phone, even an Alexa Dot....all of them were driving me nuts. The E-Box fit them all and even matches my white subway tile & gray cement countertops. It's plastic but blends in so well I barely notice it's there at all. And my phone can lay on top while it's charging. Only complaint? The gray top is a bit of a pain to take off. It snaps in place easily but removal is much harder. I imagine the plastic could crack easily if one doesn't take care. This is the reason I'm giving 4 stars. An easy top removal would deserve 5
customer_reviews.author: J. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: NOT child-resistant as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable organizer box because it specifically says it is child-resistant in the description. In reality the box lid is held on by a plastic tab that is a few millimeters in length. A light breeze would knock the lid off, never-mind a curious baby or determined toddler. It functions okay as a cable organizer but there are nicer, sturdier models for only a few dollars more. If you are looking for something to keep kids out, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Nice touch. Be careful of large power adapters though.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a silly purchase at first, but it is quite nice to have cord clutter hidden away while keeping easy access to those cords. However, I have a MacBook Pro power adapter (the largest, 85w for a 15") plugged into a power strip and the box is a bit too small. It fits, the strip on its side and the power adapter laying flat, but the cord is cramped, pressed against the side and bent. So, I worry this isn't the best box for those (expensive) power adapters.
customer_reviews.author: pburg

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dozens of cords near and organized!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and looks good sitting on counter. Helps contain the mess of cords needed for all of our devices. Been using it for months and still looks new. Easy to dust and hasn’t discolored or cracked. Great improvement to keep things organized bc everything is in one place. The kids no longer take the cords to use other places. Just make sure to keep extra cables readily available bc you don’t want to take apart the set up or be tethered to the box. We have a picture frame and pencil sharpener plugged in at all times. We used one of those combo power strips with built in ports so we didn’t need to use power bricks.
customer_reviews.author: Holly's Corner of the World

customer_reviews.title: The only "person" not pleased with this product is my puppy
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what I hoped it would do. It's keeping my puppy away from all my cords and adapters. The lid to it is so secure that even I have a hard time getting it off. The only "person" not pleased with this product is my puppy. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: D A

customer_reviews.title: Good product, clean look, lid doesn’t snap shut
customer_reviews.text: Likes: hides all the wires poking out of the power strip, out of sight out of mind power over my toddler, even has room for a fish tank pump, blends in with the room, loved that it came with wore organizer strips Dislikes: the lid doesn’t snap shut *easy fix with scotch tape, toddler can’t open lid
customer_reviews.author: The Squid

customer_reviews.title: Organizing cords is a pain!
customer_reviews.text: I like this little box. It allows me to put my power strip inside along with all the cords I've plugged into it, in the box and put the cover on it and it is out of the way and all those plugs and cords aren't laying all over the place. A nice little way to keep them out of sight and away from my dogs that sometimes nose around where they shouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Would buy another
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use it where I initially thought, but where I did use it look so much more organized. 7 items plugged into a strip, with wires all over the place, all out of sight now. The only thing to be wary of is the width of the unit compared to the power strip. Mine fit, but it couldn't have been much wider. I will be looking for another.
customer_reviews.author: Aramat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at hiding cables. Happy wife, Happy Life
customer_reviews.text: I am forever adding thing to our smart home and home office (3 monitors, 2 printers, 2 USB outlets, monitor divider, cables cables cables) and generally making a mess with cables ALL over my house. Today I spent 4 hours rerouting everything downstairs as it should be and it looks professionally done and filled 4 boxes. My Wife is Happy and I don’t need to be embarrassed when visitors come...... well after I finish i buy another 4 and do the garage and everything upstairs. :-). I don’t usually write reviews, but I am so impressed .....
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, dollar store shoe box.
customer_reviews.text: Very suprised by cheap material. Looks cheap. Is cheap. The lid does not even stay on the top/does not click into place. Def not safe for toddlers or pets as nothing secures the top on. This is like a dollar store shoe box with cut outs for vents. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: andrea m

customer_reviews.title: So tidy and clean looking!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even know something like this existed! I’m so glad I came across this listing. I have all of my TVs in my home mounted and clean looking except for one and the cords behind that old tv have bothered me for over a year. Adding this box helped clear the clutter and it’s easy to take the top off and plug other items in if needed. 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kmiles2013

customer_reviews.title: White Box is NOT What is Delivered;  It is Yellowish.
customer_reviews.text: Great design on product, but the color is not white. It is a beige or yellowish (same color as when plastic sits in sun for an extended period). Clearly, a problem with quality control. Color is such a basic issue, so it is odd that they missed it. The cardboard box that it came in was clearly white and you could see that this product was not white in its box container.. Box was white. Product was not. I did not bother to return it, as it was too much trouble. I would post a picture but I threw it away into the recycling bin.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty standard
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but it keeps developing a weird stain on the outside (see picture) that I keep having to clean off - no idea what it is. I also wish the lid stayed on a little better and was less clunky to remove and replace.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Choi

customer_reviews.title: I love how this works
customer_reviews.text: I love how this works, with the phone cable able to come out of the top, and this will be very difficult for a toddler to open it. I'm not saying he couldn't, if he sat there for awhile and tried really hard, but it takes alot for me to open it, so it's great to hide for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fermaint

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Pros Industrial design is better than average, slots to allow power cords to pass from the interior upward toward top surface, color can blend into most home decor, size will accommodate most power strips. Cons Flimsy construction, thin walls of the box does not inspire confidence, snap lid will wear over time, lack of rubber feet allows the box to slide around
customer_reviews.author: Ray Yao

customer_reviews.title: Cheap look and much bulkier
customer_reviews.text: I just got two in the mail and they look much bigger than the pictures, I might as well buy a computer with no cables, returning both. The plastic looks very shinny and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: George A.

customer_reviews.title: Not Apple style at all
customer_reviews.text: It serves the purpose but definitely not Apple style at all like advertised. it is made with cheap-looking plastics, and there is no mechanism to lock the top cover, so you would have to tape around it if you are buying for baby safety.
customer_reviews.author: pico

customer_reviews.title: No baby proof
customer_reviews.text: Initially I bought it to hide cords frim our 9 months old son.I cannot do it because lid just lying on top of the box.So baby can pick it up and easily access cords.I still use it in another place where baby cannot get it.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Really got tired at looking at my power cord laying on my bedroom floor with 5 different cords coming out of it. I was VERY pleased with this cable organizer. I had the cords tucked away and organized in minutes - and my floor is clear except for this one box. It is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Clean solution for cables
customer_reviews.text: This cord organizer is solid. I have a large surge protector and Sonos Hub hidden in mine and it does a great job at concealing my mess of cables under a bookshelf. The only thing that's a little bit of a pain would be plugging in a laptop charger super quickly, because you have to remove the lid and route all your cables through the underside of the box. Super minor gripe, otherwise this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: h000k

customer_reviews.title: Organizes cords and no more "spaghetti cables"
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. I had cords all over my office floor. I got this cable organizer and just put a surge power strip in. Then gathered up all the cables, untangled them and plugged them into the power strip. Closed the lid and every thing is hidden and organized. Took me maybe 15 minutes and it's done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer FRJ

customer_reviews.title: Fits a smaller power strip, smaller cables
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, but it doesn't really fit power strips that well. If are only running in a very small power strip and a minimal number of cables, this would work great. If you have a bit of a heftier setup, you might want to look for something a little bigger. We ended up just cramming what we could into the box and the lid wouldn't fit on it no matter what we did.
customer_reviews.author: briggs217

customer_reviews.title: Great way to hide your cables and surge protector
customer_reviews.text: Judging by the size of the inside of this box, it should fit most surge protectors out there as long as you don't have a ridiculously large one. I also do like the fact the box is tall enough so that you won't be fighting your cords to get the lid back on the box. Overall, this is a great way to hide and protect your cables. My only complaint is the price still seems high for what is essentially only a plastic box.
customer_reviews.author: Brett O.

customer_reviews.title: This keeps them nice and neat and out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what its supposed to do. Keeps the Power Strip and all the connected power cables out of sight, neat and organized. Only challenge I had was the need to unplug everything to put the power strip inside the box and then re-route the power cables into the box. Once done though, I no longer found myself stepping on or kicking the power cords on the floor. This keeps them nice and neat and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell BellTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 stars...The plastic feels wicked cheap compared to others. I have a few other brands and they feel more solid and less like they are going to break when my cat sits on them. Probably would just go with someone else next time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Counts

customer_reviews.title: Helpful product and the zip ties are a nice bonus
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of the giant mess of wires behind my entertainment unit, and this helps wrangle everything. I liked the Velcro zip ties that come in with this box, you get a lot of them and so far the stick together well. The zip ties help keep the extra length of cord that sits in the box neat and untangled. The box seems sturdy and looks nice (mine is hidden but if yours is going to be out in the open it’s got a clean look to it).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a win for tidiness
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing not to like. My husband saw it come out of the box and assumed it was for him. He wants his own. There are actually a couple more places in the house that could use one: His office, His AV room, the cluster of wires by the nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Yet Attractive | 1 Month Review
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I shouldn't like a simple plastic box so much, but it manages to be useful and attractive. Our white and grey color scheme helps make this thing blend in naturally in the room. It fits a standard size power strip easily and allows all of the cables to come out in a bundle from the top. I will likely buy more to place in other rooms, especially with a baby on the way. 10/10 Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Lid fits securely
customer_reviews.text: Lid fits securely to keep rampant cords in check. White color blends in nicely with my decor. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dina P

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking well vented box for hiding your messy cable nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I got this box to solve a mess that was behind my desk. It solved the issue well. It is a really good size and is well vented if you put a power brick in there. Thanks to this box, I am able to bundle my cables and get them out of the way. I think it also looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: uuklangerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well overall
customer_reviews.text: The cords were difficult to get in and some poke out some, but they are at least tucked out of the way for the most part. This organizer keeps my robot vacuum from getting tangled up in the cords, so that is all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Just a little large.
customer_reviews.text: I am kind of neutral on this product. I bought it and have kept it and am using it. However, it is a little larger than I expected. All of the cables and connectors, etc from my television in my dressing area are in it and are hidden, but you do see this large white box now.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R Plunk

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, I mean I put all of my ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay, I mean I put all of my wires through but it gets kind of messy when you have cords that have different lengths. Also the design in itself is rather bulky which didn’t seem to be the case from the photos
customer_reviews.author: Ash K

customer_reviews.title: but it looks very nice and keeps our new home looking neat
customer_reviews.text: This item cleaned up an unsightly mess on our bathroom vanity and even allowed a place to put a countertop towel rack that wasn't tall enough. It doesn't solve the problem of big plugs that take up at least 2 spaces in the surge protector, but it freed up space in the outlet to plug those in. It's just a box with some holes in it, but it looks very nice and keeps our new home looking neat.
customer_reviews.author: Pat f.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get cords in
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to thread the cords in through the bottom of this box. Usually organizers like this have top notches for the cables, just under the lid, but this one made it impossible to get some of the larger ones with big power adapters through at all. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't help much...
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, but the product is clunky. Takes up a lot of space and can't fit all of the chords neatly inside. Honestly, at best, it doesn't change anything. I think it makes accessing chords more difficult
customer_reviews.author: Emily Aderhold

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this on Amazon one day. So I decided to give it a shot to help manage my cables and hide some power strips. It does a good job of doing that. I will probably get one or two more in the black color.
customer_reviews.author: pujones1

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but might not be durable.
customer_reviews.text: The boxes looks great, my only issue is that it feels flimsy and after handling a few times may break. The lid should have a latch of sorts, but the box is doing the job it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: A. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Love this , nice size ,and looks so much better than all the cords showing. I little hard getting the lid off the first time. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It works but I could've used a $10 decorative box just as easily
customer_reviews.text: This box served it's purpose but appears cheaper than I expected, especially given the price. I think it's just as easy to repurpose an old shoe box or decorative box.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Parent

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea!
customer_reviews.text: I love having a box I can use to organize my cords without doing too much work! I use it at my desk from all my electronics. I keep it on top of the desk and it looks great! It is easier to reach the cords and is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie NelsonTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This Box works great and looks great. Hides all those ugly cords and clutter in my office. Reasonable price. Would recommend. I am going to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy O

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my baby safer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 month old who's crawling all over and loves cables. This box was big enough to help us hide 2 extension cords along with everything that's plugged in. My baby is not getting drawn to the cables anymore, and it would take a lot for him to open that box even if he had some time alone (most likely will never happen).
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I had those hideous cables dangling and now it’s all organized as much as I could with the length of the cables. Perfect! I can already tell it gets dirty very easily but don’t care, I’ll just have to keep wiping.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: It's kept our 1 year old from playing with the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's kept our 1 year old from playing with the power strip and cords far and it's well vented so it does what I needed it to. My only issue is that the holes for the cords should be a little higher up. The box itself doesn't sit flush with the floor because the cords are too thick.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Hides Cords Great
customer_reviews.text: Hides the cords and the power strips. Nice and breathable so nothing gets too hot. Cleans up the desk area nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a bit over priced but it gets the job done and looks nice. It's elevated off the ground and the bottom is vented to prevent over heating. In mine i have 1 power strip. Xbox 1 power box, 1 Xbox 360 power box and 1 sound bar power box. So it can hold it's fair share. I liked it enough to buy a second one
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good, but room for improvement in the lid design
customer_reviews.text: This would be better if the lid clipped on somehow instead of just resting on there, if you made it actually child proof you'd sell way more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's fine. Looks decent
customer_reviews.text: It's fine. Looks decent, and does what it says, but is too expensive for what it is. It's a cheap, thin walled plastic box with a cheap, thin plastic cover. Should cost $10, max. If you have an decent knife or cutting tool you could easily convert an existing box to do what this does.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: One of these can house two power strips
customer_reviews.text: These Power Cable boxes are perfect, I love how the cables come in from underneath, and inside they are big enough for 2 power strips. I have 2 of these now and they have significantly tidied up the wires behind the TV. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Secure and spacious with excellent venting
customer_reviews.text: Secure and spacious with excellent venting. I needed to secure the cord rat nest by the outlet (baby beginning to crawl) and this works perfectly! Lid is very secure, it's easy to use (didn't even have to unplug the multi power strip), aesthetically pleasing, and safe. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had such a mess of cords on my kitchen counter for two coffee pots, land line telephone and two cell phone chargers. This handy unit certainly helped me hide all the unsightly cords while taking up minimal space on my counter. Plus the flat top of this unit now holds my cell phones while they are charging.
customer_reviews.author: misly

customer_reviews.title: i LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: i LOVE IT!! I should have bought it sooner! my PC area is so much more organized now :) very stylish and doesn't look cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: There are no instructions on this. It’s just a bulky storage box with vents at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: This cleaned up my work area within minutes. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This cleaned up my work area within minutes. I wish I would have done a before and after picture. Everyone who has seen my previous "cable management" was shocked to see what this box did to help. I am totally going to buy this for my husbands work area as well!
customer_reviews.author: Armada Jones

customer_reviews.title: Keep electric cords off the floor and out of cultter way
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 5 stars because this item keeps my electric cords from causing cultter.
customer_reviews.author: Alice People

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as easy as the blue lounge boxes
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but I prefer the other cable boxes I've purchased. Unfortunately, due to how this cable box is designed, you will have to unplug everything from the power strip to fit it into the box. Not quite as easy as the blue lounge boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: This is a great box to hide my surge protector and all the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great box to hide my surge protector and all the cords. It arrived in new condition. Very happy with the clean appearance of this box.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia F. Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: great cable organizer
customer_reviews.text: cable organizer underneath my desk. wasn't looking for anything fancy, but clean and neat looking organizer. material feels little cheap and light plastic, but at least it's white and gray top. it's also great to put stuff on top of the organizer. if need somethign quick and neat looking cable organizer, recommemded!
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: It's a box
customer_reviews.text: It's a box that hides the eye sore that is your surge protector. It can fit wide/thicc protectors. I wish the lid would snap on tighter but other than that it does what its suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my bunnies from eating my cables.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been rabbit proof. Pretty clever! And the bottom slats keeps it from getting too hot in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lmvander

customer_reviews.title: This item is fine except for difficulty opening lid
customer_reviews.text: The lid sticks so tightly- instructions say to open lid with a coin! This does not make it convenient to use- sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Bright spot

customer_reviews.title: Not really secure
customer_reviews.text: My one year old daughter was able to open it, I had to put extra protection. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Gil

customer_reviews.title: Nice to declutter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice way to clean up the looks of a lot of cards. I really like that it has multiple usb chargers
customer_reviews.author: R. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: No more wires
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product to hide and control connecting cables for electronics such as computer and TV. Really helps the area look neat and tidy!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Lid does not stay closed
customer_reviews.text: The lid does not stay closed and easily falls of the box.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Measure before you buy!
customer_reviews.text: Measure your stuff. If you’re used to other cable boxes you’ll want to measure first. My surge protector didn’t fit. Pros - Cable routing is great - Has a nice look to it Cons - Smaller than others on the market
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Manley

customer_reviews.title: It's a good looking plastic box with holes.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and functions exactly as it should. The lid clicks in nicely and the wide openings on the bottom of both sides for entering and existing cords is great. It accommodates a large, wide power strip and the bulky transformers on the computer and baby monitor. Good buy. Feel comfortable buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota Food Lover

customer_reviews.title: Tidy Up!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and a great way to make your space look good and tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: You have a good product and we like it. Still have some wires running around. I wish it came in total jet black. We like what you have produced.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Service
customer_reviews.text: I personally used this box to hide some Ethernet cables that were long and 1 power strip. It works great and did exactly what I wanted, which was to hide the excess wires. The box itself is a pretty good size with a bunch of cutouts for wires on the bottom and I believe 1 on each top side. The box is light due to the fact it's made from plastic. Overall, it does the job for me and I would buy it again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase. But dont use them anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, but still a pain to deal with wires.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L Evans

customer_reviews.title: My cables are finally under control
customer_reviews.text: It's a plastic box with a removable lid and enough room to fit a super heavy duty power strip and all the attached cords and cables. A super easy way to clean up the mess that tends to gather around every computer desk.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Stroud

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product. It does exactly what it is advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. It does exactly what it is advertised to do-hide away all those ugly electric cables. I rated it 4 stars because it is a little too pricey. Other than that, it's a purchase I don't regret. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Muniz

customer_reviews.title: cable organizer
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I was looking for to organize all my cords under my nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great so far..
customer_reviews.text: Out of everything I bought to kitten-proof my home, this has to be one of the best products so far. It's large with a top that's not easy to remove. Plenty of space for a long power strip and a surplus of wires that I didn't want laying around for my cats to chew on. Will most likely purchase more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Elaina

customer_reviews.title: Stylishly keeps my cables mostly organized and the inevitable geek's ...
customer_reviews.text: Stylishly keeps my cables mostly organized and the inevitable geek's rat's nest hidden from view. It has that Apple aesthetic going on. What else can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Spencaur!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to hide all the cords under my computer desk as it is visible from my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Carole L. Horst

customer_reviews.title: Good cord cover
customer_reviews.text: I have so many cords! I put my siege protector in, wrap cords and put the lid on! Right price too!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Stubbeman

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to hide all those cables that were cluttering up our living room . Well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: sand sand

customer_reviews.title: Small interior
customer_reviews.text: It was nice enough, but the interior was too small to fit a standard power strip Ann a macbook charger
customer_reviews.author: Gravelle

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy product but may not fit all 10/12-port ...
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy product but may not fit all 10/12-port surge protectors as they may be too long (refer to this model instead for longer surge protectors:). The lower holes that feed the cables through also are a bit tight and so the box may not sit flush with the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Davos

customer_reviews.title: What Organization!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought 2 of them. So nice not seeing all those needed cords everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie @ the Beach

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t know how much we needed it!
customer_reviews.text: Really cleaned up the look in our living room. In the age of power cords, this hides the rat nest of cords from phone chargers to lamps. Blends in with our baseboards.
customer_reviews.author: Glad to be Mad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for entertainment center surge protector.
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly. It was just what I needed to fit my surge protector in and as an added plus it looks good. Now the cables aren't visible which was attracting my baby boy to pull on the cables. Now he doesn't even realize it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby J Fabela

customer_reviews.title: Love to his product!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Hides all my cords and gets rid of the mess of all tangled ugly cords.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: no more cables under foot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go under my desk where my desktop computer and printer are located. It looks so much neater and I don't have the wires under the desk so I can't step on them like I used to. It was a wonderful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: granny Glay

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space for extra cable length
customer_reviews.text: No rubber feet so it slides a lot. The white tone is shooting for beige. Wish it was quartz white or ice white instead. Other than that it works as intended and the zip ties helped with the cable management.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Barreto

customer_reviews.title: Clean and organized
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned up my space in seconds! It went from cluttered to organized - and it's so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. My cables are now nice and neat ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. My cables are now nice and neat as opposed to a jumble of wires. Liked first box so much that I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy L Bogutski

customer_reviews.title: This was one of the best gifts that I have ever received
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best gifts that I have ever received. It's so incredibly simple that boggles my mind that I had not use it sooner. My cables looks so neat and organized that it's an absolute pleasure to look at now.
customer_reviews.author: JW tucson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this box until it broke from me simply opening it. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: GO-Oblong Cable Organizer – Slim Design for Desktop or Floor – Apple-Style Power Cable Organizer Eliminates Tangled, Messy Cords (with 20 Cable Ties).
product_meta.description:
Secure Electronic Cable Organization That’s Both Easy AND Elegant! 

What’s behind your desk or entertainment center? If you’re like most of us, it’s a giant mess of tangled, ugly wires and cables! We live in an age where our electronics are almost as important to us as breathing… and with electronics comes messy cables!

You’ve probably thought about investing in a cable organizer to clean up your work or entertainment area… but most of the options on the market today are just plain ugly! Plus, they’re poorly designed, so they can slide off your desk and even cause your cables to overheat.

We Designed the Go-Oblong Cable Concealer Differently!

When we set out to create this cable organizer, we wanted it to be both beautiful and functional. That’s why we used Apple-inspired minimalist styling and scratch-resistant materials – you get simple beauty that lasts!

But we didn’t stop there! We made sure that our cable concealer is easy-to-use, and worry-free.

Non-slip raised feet to keep your organizer securely on your desk!

A raised inner platform to keep spilled liquids away from your cables!

Grid ventilation to prevent cables and power supplies from overheating!

A concealed plug-and-charge design that lets you charge your phones, tablets, cameras, and other small devices right on top of the unit!

PLUS… as a bonus, we’re giving you a 20-pack of hook-and-loop cable ties to make organizing your electronic cables, wires, and chargers effortless!
feature_bullets: SAY GOODBYE TO CABLE “SPAGHETTI” – Easy-to-use cable concealer organizes and hides your power, aux, HDMI, USB, and other cables to leave your work or entertainment space tidy!

DESIGNED WITH FUNCTIONALITY IN MIND – We’ve included a raised inner plate that protects cables against spills. Plus, you can safely charge your phones and other small devices on top of the charger cable organizer – no need to worry about damaging your devices!

ELEGANT AND SIMPLE – With Apple-inspired simplicity, a scratch-resistant exterior, and a sleek slim profile, this power cable concealer adds a look of sophistication to your entertainment or work area. And with dimensions of just 14.3”(L)x5.5”(L)x4.7”(H), it keeps your cables and wires organized without taking up too much space on your desk, entertainment center, or floor.

NO MORE OVERHEATING – Crowded cables and power supplies can overheat, damaging your valuable electronics and even causing the risk of fire. But our unique grid platform provides ventilation to keep your concealed wires and cables cool.

BONUS: HOOK-AND-LOOP CABLE TIES – When you purchase your Go-Oblong charger cable organizer, we’re also including a bonus 20-pack of hook-and-loop cable ties to make organizing and securing your cables a snap!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars515 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
